title: Living Troubleshooting Workflow Template
body:
Purpose: Repeatable end-to-end incident investigation workflow leveraging established MCP toolsets (azureDebugging, codeAnalysis, powerShellDiagnostics, devOpsIntelligence) to reduce MTTD/MTTM and standardize outputs.

Phases:
1. Intake & Scope: Capture incident metadata (scope, impact, severity, owner) + decision log.
2. Reproduce / Confirm Signal: Validate current/fresh issue; establish measurable failure condition.
3. Initial Fact Pack: Low-cost evidence (deploy state, metrics deltas, hot code paths, policy constraints) within 10 minutes.
4. Hypothesis Drafting: Structured H# entries (statement, supporting signals, risk, test method) prioritized by Impact * Likelihood.
5. Deep Dive: Targeted telemetry & lineage correlation (kusto, datadog, build logs, workflow logs, code references).
6. Narrow & Validate: Confirm mechanistic root cause; verify reproducibility; ensure fix path viability.
7. Fix Implementation & Verification: Patch, CI pass, staged deploy, canary metrics, rollout, rollback plan recorded.
8. Post-Incident Consolidation: Timeline, root cause statement, contributing factors, blast radius, MT* metrics.
9. Preventative Actions & Backlog: Action table + sunset criteria (all high-impact items complete & no recurrence window).

Toolset Mapping:
- azureDebugging → monitor, kusto, azureActivityLog, datadog
- codeAnalysis → codebase, search, usages, problems
- powerShellDiagnostics → powershell-syntax-check, run-powershell, server-stats, working-directory-policy
- devOpsIntelligence → build_get_log, build_get_status, get_job_logs, get_workflow_run_logs

Prompt Library Seeds:
1. Baseline Metrics Delta (compare current vs prior window deviations > 2σ).
2. Build Failure Trace (map failing steps to changed files).
3. PowerShell Script Root Cause (validate syntax + constraints + hotspots).
4. Cross-System Correlation (kusto + workflow logs align errors to artifact versions).

Acceptance Criteria for Root Cause: Mechanistic, reproducible (or strongly correlated), fix vector identified.
Validation Checklist: Controlled patch test, metric regression absence, clean pipeline.

Versioning Policy: Patch = formatting; Minor = new section/prompt/metric; Major = structural overhaul or phase redefinition.
Maintenance: Monthly review or post P1/P2. Current Version: 0.1.1.

Anti-Patterns: Premature deep-dive before fact pack; hypothesis sprawl without pruning; mixing destructive tools; skipping rollback definition.

Usage Prompt Template: "Apply phases 1–3; return fact pack + top 3 hypotheses ranked with proposed validation steps."
requirement: Provide structured reusable incident troubleshooting workflow aligned with available MCP toolsets.
